intro: Dicliptera riparia, commonly known as the river sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and riparian habitats. It typically grows in shallow waters or moist soils along rivers and streams. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its root system helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion in aquatic environments. Dicliptera riparia is an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various aquatic and terrestrial wildlife.
